Major_Arcs.title: Disillusionment in Ghost Town and Airport Announcement
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Nan's dissatisfaction with her life in 'Ghost Town', her rejection of Cal's advances, and the shocking announcement of the town's impending demolition for an airport.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Longing and Rejection
sub_scenes.description: Nan expresses her unhappiness and rejects Cal's romantic advances, revealing her desire for a more exciting life beyond 'Ghost Town'.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Rejection and the Ghost Town Mystery

sub_scenes.title: Cal's Departure and Airport Revelation
sub_scenes.description: Cal departs, frustrated by Nan's rejection. Simultaneously, new characters arrive, revealing plans to build an airport, which will lead to the demolition of 'Ghost Town', shocking Nan.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Frustrated Departure from Ghost Town
Arrival at Merrick Gulch and the 'Ghost Town' Label
Airport Development Plans for the Ghost Town
Nan's Distress and Realization of Ghost Town's Demolition

Major_Arcs.title: Reconciliation, Cynicism, and Confrontation in Ghost Town
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shows Nan apologizing to Cal and discussing the airport plans. It also depicts a confrontation between Nan and rough men, highlighting the changing dynamics of 'Ghost Town'.

sub_scenes.title: Nan and Cal's Evolving Conversation
sub_scenes.description: Nan apologizes to Cal and attempts to discuss the practical aspects of the airport, leading to Cal's cynical monologue about love and 'Ghost Town'.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Apology and Practical View of the Airport
Nan's Reflection on Her Harsh Reaction to Cal
Cal's Cynical Monologue on Love and Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Rough Men
sub_scenes.description: Nan is confronted by a group of rough men who make unwelcome advances and express their views on the changing 'Ghost Town', creating a hostile atmosphere.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Rough Men and Nan's Resistance

Major_Arcs.title: Airport Practicalities, Family Conflict, and Nan's Resolve
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores the practicalities of the airport development, Nan's frustrations with her father, and her emotional turmoil leading to a resolve to understand Cal's true feelings.

sub_scenes.title: Airport Benefits and Father's Dismissal
sub_scenes.description: The rough men discuss the benefits of the airport. Nan expresses her frustration about the airport to her father, who dismisses her concerns.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Airport Frustration and Father's Dismissiveness

sub_scenes.title: Father-Daughter Argument and Nan's Humiliation
sub_scenes.description: An argument erupts between Nan and her father over horses. Nan feels humiliated and reflects on her disappointment with Cal in bed.

narrative_arcs.title: Horses for Construction and Father-Daughter Argument
Nan's Humiliation and Reflection in Bed

sub_scenes.title: Advice and Nan's Decision
sub_scenes.description: Nan receives advice from her mother, father, and maid regarding her relationship with Cal. Nan resolves to discover Cal's true feelings.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother's Advice on Love and Childishness
Father's Pragmatic Advice to Focus on Cal
Maid's Reassurance of Cal's Love and Need for Patience
Nan's Resolve to Know Cal's True Feelings

Major_Arcs.title: Nan's Pursuit, Ranch Duties, and Father's Deal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shows Nan pursuing Cal to understand his feelings, but she gets diverted by ranch duties and a conflict with her father about a deal.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Pursuit of Cal Interrupted
sub_scenes.description: Nan decides to pursue Cal but is interrupted by ranch duties and a ranch hand.

narrative_arcs.title: Horses Arriving and Ranch Hand's Request for Help

sub_scenes.title: Argument with Father on Horseback
sub_scenes.description: Nan has an argument with her father while riding a horse, related to a deal he made.

narrative_arcs.title: Argument with Father About a Deal

Major_Arcs.title: Emotional Confession, Stampede, and Time Skip to Reunion
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Nan and Cal's emotional confession, followed by a horse stampede, a time skip, and their eventual reunion after a period of loneliness.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confession and Departure
sub_scenes.description: Nan confesses her emotions to Cal, and Cal explains his actions. He then departs for work.

sub_scenes.title: Time Skip and Reunion
sub_scenes.description: A time skip narrates Cal's absence and Nan's loneliness, followed by their eventual reunion and Cal's confession of his feelings.

Major_Arcs.title: Snowstorm and Community Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the sudden and severe snowstorm that engulfs 'Ghost Town', creating a community crisis and testing relationships.

sub_scenes.title: Weather Concerns and Reports
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal continue their conversation amidst growing weather concerns. Reports of extreme snow depth circulate, causing worry.

sub_scenes.title: Despair, Hope, and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Cal expresses despair, but hope arrives with a plane dropping fodder. Nan and Cal emotionally resolve their relationship amidst the crisis, finding romance in the 'ghost town'.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: Arrival of the Plane

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Town Skepticism
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson through a dramatic confrontation and explores the townspeople's skeptical reactions to his heroic image, setting up a new conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Chane Benson's Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is depicted in a dramatic confrontation, establishing him as a central figure and sparking reactions from bystanders.

sub_scenes.title: Townspeople's Skeptical Reactions
sub_scenes.description: Various townspeople react to Chane Benson's actions with skepticism and sarcasm, questioning his heroic portrayal.

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Gun Obsession and Benson Article Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Jeff's fascination with guns and the escalating conflict surrounding an article criticizing Chane Benson, leading to threats and defiance.

sub_scenes.title: Woman's Concern about Jeff
sub_scenes.description: A woman expresses her concern about Jeff's unhealthy obsession with guns, foreshadowing potential trouble.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Mr. Benson and Ominous Advice
sub_scenes.description: Mr. Benson is introduced and provides ominous advice, mentioning Chane Benson and violence, adding a layer of foreboding.

narrative_arcs.title: Ominous Advice and Mention of Violence

sub_scenes.title: Public Discussion and Benson's Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Townspeople discuss an article criticizing Chane Benson. Benson confronts Clyde about the article, leading to threats and Sally's warnings.

narrative_arcs.title: Public Discussion about Chane Benson's Reputation and Article
Confrontation and Warning in the Office
Clyde's Determination to Publish Articles Despite Threats

Major_Arcs.title: Dinner Invitation, De-escalation Attempt, and Betrayal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores the aftermath of the article, including public reaction, a dinner invitation for Chane Benson, and escalating tensions leading to confrontation and betrayal.

sub_scenes.title: Public Reaction and Dinner Plan
sub_scenes.description: Public reaction to Clyde's articles is shown, and a plan emerges to invite Chane Benson to dinner in an attempt to de-escalate the situation.

narrative_arcs.title: Public Reaction to Clyde's Articles and Jeff's Insight
Considering a Dinner Invitation for Chane Benson
Awkward Dinner and Jeff's Demonstration for Chane

sub_scenes.title: Moonlit Confrontation and Sally's Accusations
sub_scenes.description: Sally confronts Chane Benson in the moonlight, accusing him and questioning his motives, leading to escalating accusations and threats.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Accusation and Chane's Evasive Response
Escalating Accusations and Threat of Violence
Sally's Confrontation with Jeff about Betrayal
Sally's Outburst and Accusation of Manipulation

Major_Arcs.title: Showdown with Benson, Pursuit, and Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc culminates in a showdown with Chane Benson, Jeff's determined pursuit to save Clyde, and the eventual resolution with Benson leaving town and a reflection on courage and decency.

sub_scenes.title: Misunderstanding and Benson's Dominance
sub_scenes.description: Misunderstandings arise, and Chane Benson asserts his dominance over Sally and Jeff.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Danger and Urgent Action
Confrontation with the Editor and Townsmen

sub_scenes.title: Flashback and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Flashbacks reveal the tension before the showdown. The confrontation resolves with Benson leaving town, and a reflection on courage and family legacy in journalism.

narrative_arcs.title: Flashback to Clarion Office - The Ticking Clock
Flashback - Uncertainty and Fear Behind the Door
Reflection on Family, Courage, and Decency in Journalism

Major_Arcs.title: Introduction of Betsy and Steve - Ranch Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Betsy and Steve, setting up the ranch conflict and their initial interactions amidst rising tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Physical Threat and Steve's Introduction
sub_scenes.description: A physical confrontation sets a tense tone, followed by the introduction of Steve Daley as the new 'boss' at Betsy's ranch.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley to Betsy
Confirmation of Hiring and Foreshadowing Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Settling In and Ranch Troubles Revealed
sub_scenes.description: Steve settles in as ranch troubles are revealed, including missing cattle and damaged property, hinting at a range war.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Steve's Character and Past

Major_Arcs.title: Distrust, Town Confrontation, and Steve's Intervention
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shows Betsy's distrust of Steve, their journey to town, and a confrontation with Fred Bridges that leads to physical violence and Steve defending Betsy.

sub_scenes.title: Journey to Town and Lingering Distrust
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve travel to town, with Betsy still harboring distrust towards Steve despite his offer to help.

narrative_arcs.title: Journey to Town and Lingering Doubts
Leaving the Store and Betsy's Sarcasm

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Fight
sub_scenes.description: Betsy is confronted by Fred Bridges in town, leading to escalating threats and a physical fight where Steve intervenes to protect Betsy.

narrative_arcs.title: Aftermath of the Punch and Further Threat
Discussion on Gunfighters and Hornets' Nest

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy's Realization and Steve's Romantic Choice
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shows Betsy realizing Steve is a gunslinger, her initial order to fire him, her change of heart, and Steve's decision to give up his gun for her love.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Reflection and Firing Order
sub_scenes.description: Betsy reflects on Steve's gunfighting skills and initially orders Hank to fire him.

narrative_arcs.title: Hank's Understanding and Betsy's Romantic Feelings

sub_scenes.title: Steve Chooses Love over Guns
sub_scenes.description: Betsy questions Steve about his profession, leading to Steve confessing his love and agreeing to give up his gun to prove it.

Major_Arcs.title: Land Dispute, Betsy's Stance, and Devil's Pass Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the land dispute with Old Man Bridges, Betsy's firm stance against gun violence, and the resolution at Devil's Pass leading to a romantic conclusion.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Old Man Bridges
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges confronts Betsy and Hank, escalating the land dispute. Betsy and Steve discuss his threat to take over the valley.

narrative_arcs.title: Old Man Bridges' Complaint and Hank's Accusation
Betsy and Steve's Confrontation and Steve's Challenge to Hank
Betsy's Stand Against Gun Violence and Concern for Steve
Steve's Reflection on Past Mistakes and the Ambush

sub_scenes.title: Action at Devil's Pass and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: Betsy resolves to act, riding to Devil's Pass. The story culminates in a romantic reunion and resolution for Betsy and Steve at Devil's Pass.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Parting and Betsy's Worried Reflection
Betsy's Command and Ride to Devil's Pass
Arrival at Devil's Pass and Ominous Recognition
Betsy's Recovery and Reassurance by Steve

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Dave, and Fred - Romantic Triangle and Contract Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Carrie, Dave, and Fred, exploring their romantic entanglements and the conflict surrounding the Carlton contract, leading to Carrie's confrontation with Carlton.

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Concern for Dave and Range Conflict
sub_scenes.description: Carrie argues to protect Dave. A range conflict with the Bar 'C' ranch is introduced, setting up external pressures.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubled Arrival and Range Conflict
Explaining the Fence and Herd Concerns
Fred Gordon's Polite but Tense Arrival

sub_scenes.title: Flashback and Conflicted Feelings
sub_scenes.description: Flashbacks reveal past apologies and Carrie's conflicted feelings for Fred and Dave, adding emotional depth to the range conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie and Dave's Conflicted Feelings about Fred
Present Confrontation: Fred Gordon and Carrie
Carrie's Confession and Dave's Attempt to Reconcile

Major_Arcs.title: Contract Deceit and Carrie's Confrontation with Carlton
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc reveals Fred's deceit regarding the Carlton contract and culminates in Carrie confronting Mr. Carlton to secure her ranch's future.

sub_scenes.title: Fred's Contract-Driven Proposal and Carrie's Anger
sub_scenes.description: Fred reveals his deceitful, contract-driven proposal, sparking Carrie's anger and accusations of manipulation.

Major_Arcs.title: Emotional Resolution and Carrie's Future
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc brings emotional closure to Carrie's story with her father's comfort, her reflection on Fred, and a final conversation with Dave, leading to her declaration of love for Fred.

sub_scenes.title: Father's Comfort and Carrie's Reflection
sub_scenes.description: Carrie finds comfort in her father's arms and reflects on Fred's defeated expression and her own actions.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Wisdom on Love and Life
Carrie's Relief and Reflection on Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie and Fred's Reunion and Romantic Climax
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc brings Carrie and Fred back together, resolving their romantic conflict with confessions, forgiveness, and a proposal.

sub_scenes.title: Father's Illness and Misinterpretation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie expresses concern for her father's health and misinterprets Mr. Carlton's arrival, thinking it's related to Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Mr. Carlton's Arrival and Carrie's Misinterpretation

sub_scenes.title: Revelation and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: The truth about Fred's sacrifice is revealed, leading to Carrie's emotional awakening and a romantic reunion and proposal with Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Revelation of Fred's Sacrifice and Brother's Intervention
Carrie's Emotional Awakening and Ride to Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance - Brotherly Conflict and Wedding Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on Dirk's return, his injury, Rance's internal conflict, and the dramatic wedding scene leading to a complex resolution involving love and duty.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Return and Injury Reveal
sub_scenes.description: Dirk returns injured, startling Chris. His injury is revealed to be a gunshot wound, causing concern and initiating a new conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Marshal's Pursuit and Proof
sub_scenes.description: Marshal Cready arrives, pursuing Dirk. Despite denials, he finds proof of Dirk's presence, escalating the legal conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Marshal Rance Cready's Arrival and Initial Inquiry
Confirmation of Pursuit and Denial of Dirk's Presence
Rance Cready's Insistence and Proof of Dirk's Presence

sub_scenes.title: Negotiated Delay and Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Marshal Cready agrees to a delay for Dirk's recovery but insists on taking him into custody. Dirk and Chris attempt escape, pursued by the Marshal.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Injured Dirk and Assertion of Law
Rejection of Excuse and Acknowledgment of Change
Argument, Confession and Confirmation of Love
Rance's Internal Conflict and Realization of Misjudgment
Rance's Decision, Departure Announcement and Realization of Manipulation
Concern about the Marshal and Reassurance
Realization of Pursuit and Urgent Escape
Argument on Handling the Injured Person
Forced Departure and Concern for the Injured
Woman's Reflection and Understanding of Love for Rance
Return to Rance and Confrontation about Injury
Father's Departure and Hint at Private Matters
Expression of Gratitude and Love Confession
Rance's Reflections on Marriage and Dirk
